title.narrative: CHILD PROTECTION SERVICES

description.narrative: At- risk boys and girls including adolescents have improved access and benefit from age specific integrated psycho-social support, and child friendly policy, legal, diversion and alternative measures to detention and alternative care., which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: At least 3.8 million of the most vulnerable children (girls and boys) including children affected by humanitarian crisis have access and use scaled-up proven sustainable, high impact, integrated quality services for life saving, learning, development and protection in the most deprived localities in Sudan.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: At- risk boys and girls including adolescents have improved access and benefit from age specific integrated psycho-social support,and child friendly policy, legal, diversion and alternative measures to detention and alternative care.

description.narrative: 462,172 vulnerable children (190,875 Girls: 271,297 Boys) at risk or victims of violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect benefited from comprehensive, timely and gender-sensitive preventive and responsive child protection services in 92 localities in 18 states in Sudan. | Status:Met | As-of Date:16/01/2018
